div.p: A Serious Addresse TO Samuel Oates, For a Resolve in some few QUAERE'S Touching his New-Baptisme & Ministry.
ALSO A short and faithfull word of Christian Advice to those of his Church in Lincolnshire, concerning their way, and that spirit by which they are led.
Together with a brief and plain Evidence of the Ground for Baptizing a Believers Jnfant-seed.
By John Drew, a servant of Jesus Christ.

q.p: Now I beseech you Brethren, marke them which cause Divisions and offences, contrary to the Doctrine which yee have learned, and avoid them.
For they that are such, serve not our Lord Iesus Christ, but their own belly, and by good words and faire speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.
